metadata.title: CVE-2019-11715 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Due to an error while parsing page content, it is possible for properly sanitized user input to be misinterpreted and lead to XSS hazards on web sites in certain circumstances. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, and Thunderbird < 60.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-11715` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
